docs.text: Installing MkDocs ¶ Most of this is directly from https://alinex.gitlab.io/env/mkdocs/ . Kudos for great info on that site! Windows ¶ I suggest installing in Windows Services for Linux (WSL) , as follows: Install and update WSL: sudo apt-get update -y && sudo apt-get upgrade -y Install necessary packages: sudo apt install build-essential python3-dev python3-pip python3-setuptools python3-wheel python3-cffi libcairo2 libpango-1.0-0 libpangocairo-1.0-0 libgdk-pixbuf2.0-0 libffi-dev shared-mime-info Verify version (you will likely get an error here): python --version pip --version If you got an error, add these aliases to ~/.bashrc : alias python=python3 alias pip=pip3 Regardless of whether you got an error with the checking python and pip versions, add the following path to the end of ~/.bashrc : PATH=$PATH:~/.local/bin Now source .bashrc: source ~/.bashrc
